<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
IMMIGRATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/18/supreme-court-blocks-trump-administration-effort-end-daca?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Dream Is Alive
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="DACA" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNDI2L3N1cHJlbWVfY291cnQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Jahi Chikwendiu/The Washington Post via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Supreme Court <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/supreme-court/supreme-court-rules-trump-cannot-end-daca-big-win-dreamer-n1115116?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">smacked down</a> a yearslong effort by the Trump administration to ditch the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals, or DACA, program. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Former President Obama started DACA in 2012. It protects about 700,000 undocumented immigrants who were brought to the U.S. as children from deportation, and allows them to work in the U.S. legally. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Scrapping DACA was one of President Trump’s campaign promises during the 2016 election. In September 2017, his DOJ <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/immigration/trump-dreamers-daca-immigration-announcement-n798686?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced plans</a> to follow through, claiming that President Obama overreached when he created the program. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The smackdown: </strong>Was really more of a shove. In a 5–4 decision, the justices upheld the position of lower courts that the administration’s reasoning for canceling the program didn’t pass the smell test. Writing for the majority, Chief Justice John Roberts said that terminating DACA wasn’t necessarily unconstitutional, but the Trump administration’s approach was flawed. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The president didn't take it well. In a tweet, Trump called the decision “horrible & politically charged” and announced he would release a list of potential new justices by Sept. 1. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Democratic presidential challenger Joe Biden praised the ruling and pledged to make DACA permanent if elected. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The biz community also approved </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Microsoft has been one of the <a href="https://thehill.com/business-a-lobbying/business-a-lobbying/503402-microsoft-business-groups-applaud-supreme-court?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">primary voices</a> in favor of DACA and even took part in the Supreme Court case as a plaintiff. President Brad Smith tweeted that the ruling was “a victory for the country.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple CEO Tim Cook tweeted he would “keep fighting until DACA’s protections are permanent,” noting that Apple has 478 Dreamers on staff. Thomas Donohue, CEO of the Chamber of Commerce, called it “the right decision today for Dreamers, our economy, and our country.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Although it can be a lightning rod in Washington, <a href="https://news.gallup.com/poll/235775/americans-oppose-border-walls-favor-dealing-daca.aspx?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most voters</a> support DACA.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F06%2F18%2Fsupreme-court-blocks-trump-administration-effort-end-daca" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=This+is+a+major+hurdle+for+one+of+President+Trump%E2%80%99s+campaign+promises&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/18/supreme-court-blocks-trump-administration-effort-end-daca&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HOLIDAY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/18/growing-list-companies-make-juneteenth-corporate-holiday?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Corporations Join in on Juneteenth Celebrations
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">155 years ago today in Galveston, TX, Major General Gordon Granger announced that all slaves were to be set free under federal orders. In the years since, <a href="https://www.theroot.com/what-is-juneteenth-1790896900?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Juneteenth</a> (a portmanteau of June + 19th) has become an annual celebration of the end of slavery in the U.S. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now, fueled by recent protests against racial injustice, a day that’s historically been celebrated through family gatherings and community events has caught the eye of <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/17/here-are-the-companies-observing-juneteenth-this-year.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">major corporations</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Nike, Uber, Twitter, Spotify, and Target have made Juneteenth a paid holiday. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Amazon and Google encouraged employees to cancel meetings. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Capital One and JPMorgan will close branches early. Bank of America and Citigroup encouraged workers to use a personal day. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Paid holidays do incur costs for employers—an average of <a href="https://www.bls.gov/ncs/ebs/holiday_profiles.htm#01212019?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">77 cents</a> per employee hour worked. Some companies are debating replacing Columbus Day or Martin Luther King Jr. Day with Juneteenth. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>According to 2018 government estimates, MLK Day is offered as a paid holiday for 24% of private industry workers. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Calls are growing for Juneteenth to become a federal holiday. But to close stock exchanges, a presidential declaration or act of Congress is needed.</p>

<tr>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/18/ford-unveils-new-driver-assist-system?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Ford Wants You to Socially Distance From the Steering Wheel
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Ford logo no-hands" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNDIxL2ZvcmRfbG9nb19uby1oYW5kcy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Ford gave us a peek under the hood of its <a href="https://www.cnet.com/roadshow/news/ford-hands-free-driver-assist-mach-e-tesla-gm/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new driver-assist technology</a>, Active Drive Assist.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What it does: </strong>Active Drive Assist can control a vehicle's steering, braking, and speed. But there’s a driver monitoring system that ensures you’re only somewhat distracted solving the Friday Puzzle. The tech also only works on 100,000 miles of divided highways that Ford’s mapped across the U.S. and Canada. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Active Drive Assist will be available in the second half of 2021, starting with the electric Mustang <span class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Mach-E</span> SUV.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Can Ford catch up?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Advanced driver-assist systems from GM (Super Cruise) and Tesla (Autopilot) have a big head start, but objects in Elon's mirror are closer than they appear.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For one, Ford has the U.S.’ bestselling vehicle in its back pocket. The carmaker is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/18/ford-launching-new-driver-system-to-compete-with-teslas-autopilot.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">debuting</a> a redesigned F-150 next week...another potential candidate for Active Drive Assist. It’s also revealing the new Bronco, an off-road Jeep competitor, in July and an all-electric F-150 in 2022. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>With a growing debt load and a painful 2018 restructuring, Ford needs a W on its new truck.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Treat Your Ears
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="biz casual art" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNDIwL2Jpel9jYXN1YWxfYXJ0LnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On our podcast, <em>Business Casual</em>, host Kinsey Grant asks the biggest names in business the biggest questions in business. We know that’s a...big ask, but <em>Business Casual</em> guests deliver. Here are some recent episodes worth checking out:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Diversity: </strong></span><span>Medley founder </span><span><a href="https://www.businesscasual.fm/stop-thinking-start-doing-how-diversity-accountability-impact-profit/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Edith Cooper’s</a></span><span> candor and wisdom will push you to think differently and ask more questions about diversity in the workplace.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Restaurants:</strong></span><span> In this two-part series, restaurateur </span><span><a href="https://www.businesscasual.fm/imagine-a-world-without-restaurants/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Marcus Samuelsson</a></span><span> pictures a world without restaurants while </span><span><a href="https://www.businesscasual.fm/how-to-save-your-restaurant-serve-more-than-food/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sweetgreen's Nicolas Jammet and Chef JJ Johnson</a></span><span> explain the changes they expect in a post-COVID-19 world.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Drugs: </strong></span><span>Imagine your doctor telling you, “Take a magic mushroom and call me in the morning.” </span><span><a href="https://www.businesscasual.fm/trippy-business-psychedelic-drugs-microdosing-and-money/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Rick Doblin</a></span><span> dives deep on the uses of psychedelics and marijuana in clinical settings.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Hiring: </strong></span><span>If "48 minutes of pure value and crucial insights" sounds like something you would be interested in, check out our chat with LinkedIn’s Chief Economist, </span><span><a href="https://www.businesscasual.fm/economic-recovery-is-spelled-j-o-b-s/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Karin Kimbrough</a></span><span>. Kimbrough examines U.S. unemployment and tells us what needs to happen to get the economy back on its feet.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Got an idea for a future episode? Want to hear what Mark Cuban is like off the record? Take it up with Kinsey<strong style="color:#000"> </strong><a href="https://twitter.com/KinseyGrant?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">on Twitter</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>

</th>
</tr>
</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/18/last-us-part-2-released?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Escape Reality by Entering a Pandemic
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="The Last of Us Part II" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNDIyL3RoZV9sYXN0X29mX3VzX3BhcnRfaWkuanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Naughty Dog / Sony Interactive Entertainment</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At midnight ET, the videogame <em>The Last of Us Part 2 </em>was released for Sony's PlayStation 4. It’s studio Naughty Dog’s hyped follow-up to 2013’s <em>The Last of Us</em>, and the characters are...in a pandemic. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But the disease is a brain fungus, so don’t worry, not creepy at all. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Critics are saying:</strong> It’s horrific, in the best way possible. NPR describes it as “a game that punches you in the gut right from the start, and never stops punching.” But that’s not a bad thing; reviewers gushed about the game’s visuals, set pieces, and sophisticated storytelling. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The sequel also features </span><span><a href="https://www.vulture.com/2020/06/last-of-us-part-two-kiss-scene-backstory.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a gaming milestone</a></span><span>: a realistic kiss scene. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If that sounds more like a TV show than a videogame to you, you might have a future in showbiz. HBO is <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/05/last-us-coming-hbo.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">developing</a> a <em>The Last of Us</em> series from <em>Chernobyl</em> creator Craig Mazin and the game’s creative director, Neil Druckmann. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Math can be fun: </strong><a href="https://mathigon.org/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">This website</a>, which calls itself the “textbook of the future,” has lots of fun/interactive math tools to play around with. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Here’s how you can celebrate…</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Juneteenth: </strong></span><span>Attend a </span><span><a href="https://www.9news.com/article/news/local/holiday/virtual-juneteenth-celebrations/73-6c4e12ba-01d9-452f-bca8-77d1eb0bb42c?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">virtual party</a></span><span>, put on your mask and head to an IRL celebration near you (options </span><span><a href="https://laist.com/2020/06/18/10_ways_to_celebrate_juneteenth_in_la_this_year_2020.php?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">for LA</a></span><span> or </span><span><a href="https://www.ny1.com/nyc/all-boroughs/news/2020/06/17/protests-renew-interest-in-holiday-marking-end-to-slavery?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYC</a></span><span>), and learn more by listening to </span><span><a href="https://slate.com/podcasts/what-next/2020/06/juneteenth-observing-history-holiday-blm?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Slate's <em>What Next</em></a></span><span> or </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/column/1619-project?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYT’s <em>1619</em></a></span><span><strong style="color:#000"> </strong></span><span>pod. HBO's </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/6/18/21295677/watchmen-stream-free-hbo-june-19th-juneteenth-damon-lindelof-regina-king-tulsa?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Watchmen</em></a></span><span> is also free all weekend, plus you can now watch Ava DuVernay's acclaimed </span><span><em><a href="https://www.netflix.com/watch/80200643?trackId=13752289&tctx=0%2C0%2Cca93f7d3f75d22d797f3e9ae410c56ce05814bdf%3A64d2152b776cfb779cf4380177a4c012d792f221%2Cca93f7d3f75d22d797f3e9ae410c56ce05814bdf%3A64d2152b776cfb779cf4380177a4c012d792f221%2C%2C&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">When They See Us</a></em></span><span> and </span><span><em><a href="https://www.netflix.com/watch/80091741?trackId=13752289&tctx=0%2C0%2C38f69371930cfe32d88437e2257c5a51fc2f0213%3Aa7765681c423234ed64325e3a15d1c5c6c77ee71%2C38f69371930cfe32d88437e2257c5a51fc2f0213%3Aa7765681c423234ed64325e3a15d1c5c6c77ee71%2C%2C&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">13th</a></em></span><span> on Netflix, no subscription required. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Pride: </strong></span><span>View event livestreams or check out </span><span><a href="https://datebook.sfchronicle.com/guide/yes-san-francisco-is-still-celebrating-sf-pride-50-how-to-join-the-festivities-from-home?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">online exhibits</a></span><span>, join </span><span><em>Animal Crossing</em></span><span>’s </span><span><a href="https://thenextweb.com/distract/2020/06/16/animal-crossing-to-host-the-most-adorable-pride-festival-ever/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">adorable festival</a></span><span>, </span><span><a href="https://www.runnersworld.com/races-places/a32729939/nikki-hiltz-gctc-virtual-pride-5k-the-trevor-project/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">run a 5k</a></span><span> (virtually of course), or </span><span><a href="https://www.essence.com/hair/megan-thee-stallion-nicki-minaj-and-more-heat-up-pride-month-with-colorful-hair/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dye your hair</a></span><span> for fun.</span>

href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/supreme-court/supreme-court-rules-trump-cannot-end-daca-big-win-dreamer-n1115116?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esmacked down\u003c/a\u003e a yearslong effort by the Trump administration to ditch the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals, or DACA, program. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFormer President Obama started DACA in 2012. It protects about 700,000 undocumented immigrants who were brought to the U.S. as children from deportation, and allows them to work in the U.S. legally. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eScrapping DACA was one of President Trump’s campaign promises during the 2016 election. In September 2017, his DOJ \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/immigration/trump-dreamers-daca-immigration-announcement-n798686?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced plans\u003c/a\u003e to follow through, claiming that President Obama overreached when he created the program. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe smackdown: \u003c/strong\u003eWas really more of a shove. In a 5–4 decision, the justices upheld the position of lower courts that the administration’s reasoning for canceling the program didn’t pass the smell test. Writing for the majority, Chief Justice John Roberts said that terminating DACA wasn’t necessarily unconstitutional, but the Trump administration’s approach was flawed. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe president didn't take it well. In a tweet, Trump called the decision “horrible \u0026 politically charged” and announced he would release a list of potential new justices by Sept. 1. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDemocratic presidential challenger Joe Biden praised the ruling and pledged to make DACA permanent if elected. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe biz community also approved \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMicrosoft has been one of the \u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/business-a-lobbying/business-a-lobbying/503402-microsoft-business-groups-applaud-supreme-court?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprimary voices\u003c/a\u003e in favor of DACA and even took part in the Supreme Court case as a plaintiff. President Brad Smith tweeted that the ruling was “a victory for the country.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eApple CEO Tim Cook tweeted he would “keep fighting until DACA’s protections are permanent,” noting that Apple has 478 Dreamers on staff. Thomas Donohue, CEO of the Chamber of Commerce, called it “the right decision today for Dreamers, our economy, and our country.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eAlthough it can be a lightning rod in Washington, \u003ca href=\"https://news.gallup.com/poll/235775/americans-oppose-border-walls-favor-dealing-daca.aspx?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emost voters\u003c/a\u003e support DACA.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nCorporations Join in on Juneteenth Celebrations\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e155 years ago today in Galveston, TX, Major General Gordon Granger announced that all slaves were to be set free under federal orders. In the years since, \u003ca href=\"https://www.theroot.com/what-is-juneteenth-1790896900?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eJuneteenth\u003c/a\u003e (a portmanteau of June + 19th) has become an annual celebration of the end of slavery in the U.S. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow, fueled by recent protests against racial injustice, a day that’s historically been celebrated through family gatherings and community events has caught the eye of \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/17/here-are-the-companies-observing-juneteenth-this-year.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emajor corporations\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNike, Uber, Twitter, Spotify, and Target have made Juneteenth a paid holiday. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAmazon and Google encouraged employees to cancel meetings. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCapital One and JPMorgan will close branches early. Bank of America and Citigroup encouraged workers to use a personal day. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePaid holidays do incur costs for employers—an average of \u003ca href=\"https://www.bls.gov/ncs/ebs/holiday_profiles.htm#01212019?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e77 cents\u003c/a\u003e per employee hour worked. Some companies are debating replacing Columbus Day or Martin Luther King Jr. Day with Juneteenth. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAccording to 2018 government estimates, MLK Day is offered as a paid holiday for 24% of private industry workers. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eCalls are growing for Juneteenth to become a federal holiday. But to close stock exchanges, a presidential declaration or act of Congress is needed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Ford gave us a peek under the hood of its style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat it does: \u003c/strong\u003eActive Drive Assist can control a vehicle's steering, braking, and speed. But there’s a driver monitoring system that ensures you’re only somewhat distracted solving the Friday Puzzle. The tech also only works on 100,000 miles of divided highways that Ford’s mapped across the U.S. and Canada. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eActive Drive Assist will be available in the second half of 2021, starting with the electric Mustang \u003cspan class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eMach-E\u003c/span\u003e SUV.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eCan Ford catch up?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAdvanced driver-assist systems from GM (Super Cruise) and Tesla (Autopilot) have a big head start, but objects in Elon's mirror are closer than they appear.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor one, Ford has the U.S.’ bestselling vehicle in its back pocket. The carmaker is \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/18/ford-launching-new-driver-system-to-compete-with-teslas-autopilot.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edebuting\u003c/a\u003e a redesigned F-150 next week...another potential candidate for Active Drive Assist. of Us Part 2 \u003c/em\u003ewas released for Sony's PlayStation 4. It’s studio Naughty Dog’s hyped follow-up to 2013’s \u003cem\u003eThe Last of Us\u003c/em\u003e, and the characters are...in a pandemic. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut the disease is a brain fungus, so don’t worry, not creepy at all. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCritics are saying:\u003c/strong\u003e It’s horrific, in the best way possible. NPR describes it as “a game that punches you in the gut right from the start, and never stops punching.” But that’s not a bad thing; reviewers gushed about the game’s visuals, set pieces, and sophisticated storytelling. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe sequel also features \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.vulture.com/2020/06/last-of-us-part-two-kiss-scene-backstory.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea gaming milestone\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e: a realistic kiss scene. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf that sounds more like a TV show than a videogame to you, you might have a future in showbiz.
